''' Zogbodomey ''' or '''Zogbodomè''' is a town, [[Arrondissements of Benin|arrondissement]], and [[Communes of Benin|commune]] in the [[Zou Department]] of south-western [[Benin]]. The commune covers an area of 600 square kilometres and as of 2002 had a population of 72,338 people.<ref name="Atlasbenin">{{cite web|url=http://atlasbenin.africa-web.org/Zou/Zogbodomey.htm|title=Zogbodomey|publisher=Atlas Monographique des Communes du Benin|accessdate=January 5, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.statoids.com/ybj.html|title=Communes of Benin|publisher=Statoids|accessdate=January 5, 2010}}</ref>
==Administrative divisions== Zogbodomey is divided administratively into 11 arrondissements: [[Akiza, Benin|Akiza]], [[Avlamè]], [[Cana I]], [[Cana II]], [[Domè]], [[Koussoukpa]], [[Kpokissa]], [[Massi, Benin|Massi]], [[Tanwé-Hessou]], [[Zoukou, Zogbodomey|Zoukou]] and Zogbodomey. The commune contains 6 urban quarters and 59 villages.<ref name="Atlasbenin"/>
==Economy== The economy of Zogbodomey is based on agriculture, livestock, trade and agro food processing.
Agriculture employs over 80% of the population, with the main crops grown being [[maize]] and [[Bambara groundnut|groundnut]]s, but in recent years, producers are turning to other commodities such as [[vegetable]]s, [[cotton]], [[cassava]], [[soybean]]s, [[cowpeas]], and [[rice]].<ref name="economy">{{cite web|url=http://www.mairie-zogbodomey.com/pages/economie.php|title=L' Economie|publisher=Maire Zogbodomey|accessdate=January 4, 2010|language=French}}</ref>
Livestock production is limited to goats, sheep, pigs, poultry and rabbits.
Small and medium enterprises operate in Zogbodomey and transform products such as cassava, palm oil, vegetable oil and soybean etc.<ref name="economy"/>
There are a variety of markets and traders in the main town, and bars and restaurants have grown up in recent years, and new shops and stores.<ref name="economy"/>
==Notable people== *[[Georges Nobime]] (1965-)<ref>[http://www.bc-benin.org/blogs/public/Georges_NOBIME_en.pdf www.bc-benin.org] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110725045555/http://www.bc-benin.org/blogs/public/Georges_NOBIME_en.pdf |date=July 25, 2011 }}</ref>
